column1: IMPORTANT NOTE: the x,y is based on the following projected Coordinate System: NAD_1983_StatePlane_Texas_South_Central_FIPS_4204_Feet (Geographic Coordinate System: GCS_North_American_1983)

column2: An ID generated by our GIS system; this may change as data is refreshed - use the "ID" column instead
The system ID of the study; this is unique and will remain the same as data is refreshed
The name of the street on which the traffic device was placed to perform the traffic study
The portion of the street the traffic study is intending to measure
The street house address where the device was placed
The PDF file associated with the traffic study; these can be viewed through the GIS Interactive Traffic Counts Map: http://www.gims.houstontx.gov/gims/default.aspx?app_id=trafficcounts
85% of the traffic was traveling at a certain speed.
Equals Success as the City only publishes successful traffic studies

The type of study being performed. Studies include:
- Approach (intersection volume)
- Proactive studies (Classification, Local Street ADT, Major Thoroughfare ADT in order to better inform the Major Thoroughfare and Freeway Plan)
- Citizen requested surveys through the Neighborhood Traffic Management Program to measure the effectiveness of a traffic control device (Pre-NTMP is prior to the placement of a sign, speed bump, or other device and Post-NTMP attempts to measure the success of the control device)
- Other traffic control studies as needed
The ESRI projection system X of the service request
The ESRI projection system Y of the service request
The City's estimation of the Average Daily Traffic Count
The year of the traffic study
Populated for Post-NTMP studies only; the average daily traffic count after the traffic control device (speed hump, stop sign, etc.) was installed
Populated for Post-NTMP studies only; the  average speed after the traffic control device (speed hump, stop sign, etc.) was installed
